root.name: abandon
tip: Abandon a revision

root.name: absorb
tip: Move changes from a revision into the stack of mutable revisions

root.name: bisect
tip: Find a bad revision by bisection

root.name: bookmark
tip: U: bookmark [OPTIONS] <COMMAND>
Manage bookmarks

next.name: create
tip: Create a new bookmark

options.name: -r
tip: U: -r, --revision, --to <REVSET>
The bookmark's target revision [default: @]

next.name: delete
tip: Delete an existing bookmark and propagate the deletion to remotes on the next push

next.name: forget
tip: Forget a bookmark without marking it as a deletion to be pushed

next.name: list
tip: List bookmarks and their targets

next.name: move
tip: Move existing bookmarks to target revision

next.name: rename
tip: Rename `old` bookmark name to `new` bookmark name

next.name: set
tip: Create or update a bookmark to point to a certain commit

options.name: -r
tip: U: -r, --revision, --to <REVSET>
The bookmark's target revision [default: @]

options.name: -B
tip: Allow moving the bookmark backwards or sideways

next.name: track
tip: Start tracking given remote bookmarks

next.name: untrack
tip: Stop tracking given remote bookmarks

root.name: commit
tip: U: ci, commit [OPTIONS] [FILESETS]...
Update the description and create a new change on top

options.name: -i
tip: Interactively choose which changes to include in the first commit

options.name: --tool
tip: U: --tool <NAME>
Specify diff editor to be used (implies --interactive)

options.name: -m
tip: U: -m, --message <MESSAGE>
The change description to use (don't open editor)

root.name: config
tip: U: config [OPTIONS] <COMMAND>
Manage config options

next.name: edit
tip: Start an editor on a jj config file

next.name: get
tip: Get the value of a given config option

next.name: list
tip: List variables set in config files, along with their values

next.name: path
tip: Print the paths to the config files

next.name: set
tip: Update a config file to set the given option to a given value

next.name: unset
tip: Update a config file to unset the given option

root.name: describe
tip: U: describe [OPTIONS] [REVSETS]...
Update the change description or other metadata

options.name: -m
tip: U: -m, --message <MESSAGE>
The change description to use (don't open editor)

options.name: --stdin
tip: Read the change description from stdin

options.name: --edit
tip: Open an editor

root.name: diff
tip: Compare file contents between two revisions

root.name: diffedit
tip: Touch up the content changes in a revision with a diff editor

root.name: duplicate
tip: Create new changes with the same content as existing ones

root.name: edit
tip: U: edit [OPTIONS] <REVSET>
Sets the specified revision as the working-copy revision

root.name: evolog
tip: Show how a change has evolved over time

root.name: file
tip: File operations

root.name: fix
tip: Update files with formatting fixes or other changes

root.name: gerrit
tip: Interact with Gerrit Code Review

root.name: git
tip: Commands for working with Git remotes and the underlying Git repo

next.name: clone
tip: U: clone [OPTIONS] <SOURCE> [DESTINATION]
Create a new repo backed by a clone of a Git repo

options.name: --remote
tip: U: --remote <REMOTE_NAME>
Name of the newly created remote. [default: origin]

options.name: --colocate
tip: Whether or not to colocate the Jujutsu repo with the git repo

options.name: --no-colocate
tip: Disable colocation of the Jujutsu repo with the git repo

options.name: --depth
tip: U: --depth <DEPTH>
Create a shallow clone of the given depth

options.name: --fetch-tags
tip:
U: --fetch-tags <FETCH_TAGS>
Configure when to fetch tags
Unless otherwise specified, the initial clone will fetch all tags, while all subsequent fetches will only fetch included tags.

next.name: all
tip: Always fetch all tags

next.name: included
tip: Only fetch tags that point to objects that are already being transmitted

next.name: none
tip: Do not fetch any tags

next.name: export
tip: Update the underlying Git repo with changes made in the repo

next.name: fetch
tip: Fetch from a Git remote

next.name: import
tip: Update repo with changes made in the underlying Git repo

next.name: init
tip: U: init [OPTIONS] [DESTINATION]
Create a new Git backed repo

options.name: --colocate
tip: Specifies that the `jj` repo should also be a valid `git` repo, allowing the use of both `jj` and `git` commands in the same directory

options.name: --no-colocate
tip: Disable colocation of the Jujutsu repo with the git repo

options.name: --git-repo
tip: U: --git-repo <GIT_REPO>
Specifies a path to an **existing** git repository to be used as the backing git repo for the newly created `jj` repo

next.name: push
tip: Push to a Git remote

next.name: remote
tip: Manage Git remotes

next.name: root
tip: Show the underlying Git directory of a repository using the Git backend

root.name: help
tip: Print this message or the help of the given subcommand(s)

root.name: interdiff
tip: Compare the changes of two commits

root.name: log
tip: Show revision history

options.name: -r
tip: U: -r, --revisions <REVSETS>
Which revisions to show

options.name: -n
tip: U: -n, --limit <LIMIT>
Limit number of revisions to show

root.name: metaedit
tip: Modify the metadata of a revision without changing its content

root.name: new
tip: Create a new, empty change and (by default) edit it in the working copy

options.name: -m
tip: U: -m, --message <MESSAGE>
The change description to use

options.name: --no-edit
tip: Do not edit the newly created change

options.name: -A
tip: U: -A, --insert-after, --after <REVSETS>
Insert the new change after the given commit(s)

options.name: -B
tip: U: -B, --insert-before, --before <REVSETS>
Insert the new change before the given commit(s)

root.name: next
tip: Move the working-copy commit to the child revision

root.name: operation
tip: Commands for working with the operation log

next.name: abandon
tip: Abandon operation history

next.name: diff
tip: Compare changes to the repository between two operations

next.name: log
tip: Show the operation log

next.name: restore
tip: Create a new operation that restores the repo to an earlier state

next.name: revert
tip: Create a new operation that reverts an earlier operation

next.name: show
tip: Show changes to the repository in an operation

root.name: parallelize
tip: Parallelize revisions by making them siblings

root.name: prev
tip: Change the working copy revision relative to the parent revision

root.name: rebase
tip: Move revisions to different parent(s)

options.name: -b
tip: U: -b, --branch <REVSETS>
Rebase the whole branch relative to destination's ancestors (can be repeated)

options.name: -s
tip: U: -s, --source <REVSETS>
Rebase specified revision(s) together with their trees of descendants (can be repeated)

options.name: -r
tip: U: -r, --revisions <REVSETS>
Rebase the given revisions, rebasing descendants onto this revision's parent(s)

options.name: -d
tip: U: -d, --destination <REVSETS>
The revision(s) to rebase onto (can be repeated to create a merge commit)

options.name: -A
tip: U: -A, --insert-after, --after <REVSETS>
The revision(s) to insert after (can be repeated to create a merge commit)

options.name: -B
tip: U: -B, --insert-before, --before <REVSETS>
The revision(s) to insert before (can be repeated to create a merge commit)

options.name: --skip-emptied
tip:
If true, when rebasing would produce an empty commit, the commit is abandoned.
It will not be abandoned if it was already empty before the rebase.
Will never skip merge commits with multiple non-empty parents

options.name: --keep-divergent
tip: Keep divergent commits while rebasing

root.name: redo
tip: Redo the most recently undone operation

root.name: resolve
tip: Resolve conflicted files with an external merge tool

root.name: restore
tip: Restore paths from another revision

root.name: revert
tip: Apply the reverse of the given revision(s)

root.name: root
tip: Show the current workspace root directory (shortcut for `jj workspace root`)

root.name: show
tip: Show commit description and changes in a revision

root.name: sign
tip: Cryptographically sign a revision

root.name: simplify-parents
tip: Simplify parent edges for the specified revision(s)

root.name: sparse
tip: Manage which paths from the working-copy commit are present in the working copy

root.name: split
tip: Split a revision in two

root.name: squash
tip: Move changes from a revision into another revision

options.name: -r
tip:
U: -r, --revisions <REVSETS>
Revision to squash into its parent (default: @).
Incompatible with the experimental `-d`/`-A`/`-B` options

options.name: -f
tip: U: -f, --from <REVSETS>
Revision(s) to squash from (default: @)

options.name: -t
tip: U: -t, --into, --to <REVSET>
Revision to squash into (default: @)

options.name: -d
tip: U: -d, --destination <REVSETS>
(Experimental) The revision(s) to use as parent for the new commit (can be repeated to create a merge commit)

root.name: status
tip: Show high-level repo status

root.name: tag
tip: Manage tags

root.name: undo
tip: Undo the last operation

root.name: unsign
tip: Drop a cryptographic signature

root.name: util
tip: Infrequently used commands such as for generating shell completions

root.name: version
tip: Display version information

root.name: workspace
tip: Commands for working with workspaces

options.name: --version
tip: Show the version.

common_options.name: --help
tip: Show help.

common_options.name: -R
tip: U: -R, --repository <REPOSITORY>
Path to repository to operate on

common_options.name: --ignore-working-copy
tip: Don't snapshot the working copy, and don't update it

common_options.name: --ignore-immutable
tip: Allow rewriting immutable commits

common_options.name: --at-operation
tip: U: --at-operation, --at-op <AT_OPERATION>
Operation to load the repo at

common_options.name: --debug
tip: Enable debug logging

common_options.name: --color
tip: U: --color <WHEN>
When to colorize output

common_options.name: --quiet
tip: Silence non-primary command output

common_options.name: --no-pager
tip: Disable the pager

common_options.name: --config
tip: U: --config <NAME=VALUE>
Additional configuration options (can be repeated)

common_options.name: --config-file
tip: U: --config-file <PATH>
Additional configuration files (can be repeated)

description: A Git-compatible version control system that is both simple and powerful.
